medicines.name: Paracetamol 500mg
medicines.details:
Paracetamol 500mg

Primary Use: Relieves mild to moderate pain (headache, muscle ache) and reduces fever.

Instructions: Take 1-2 tablets every 4 to 6 hours as needed.

⚠️ Warning: Do not exceed 8 tablets in 24 hours. Overdose can lead to liver failure.

medicines.name: Ibuprofen 400mg
medicines.details:
Ibuprofen 400mg

Primary Use: Reduces hormones that cause inflammation and pain in the body.

Instructions: Best taken with food to protect the stomach lining.

⚠️ Warning: Long-term use can increase risk of stomach ulcers or heart issues.

medicines.name: Aspirin 75mg
medicines.details:
Aspirin 75mg

Primary Use: Low-dose aspirin helps prevent blood clots, reducing heart attack risk.

Instructions: Take once daily, ideally at the same time each day.

⚠️ Warning: May cause stomach bleeding. Consult a doctor if you notice unusual bruising.

medicines.name: Cetirizine 10mg
medicines.details:
Cetirizine

Primary Use: An antihistamine that treats hay fever, conjunctivitis, and eczema.

Instructions: Typically taken as one 10mg tablet once a day.

Note: Avoid alcohol as it can increase the sedative effect.

medicines.name: Loratadine 10mg
medicines.details:
Loratadine

Primary Use: Relieves symptoms of seasonal allergies without causing significant drowsiness.

Instructions: Take one tablet daily with or without food.

medicines.name: Amoxicillin 250mg
medicines.details:
Amoxicillin

Primary Use: Antibiotic used for chest infections, dental abscesses, and UTIs.

✅ Prescription: Only take this if prescribed by a doctor.

Warning: Complete the full course to ensure the infection is fully cleared.

medicines.name: Azithromycin 500mg
medicines.details:
Azithromycin

Primary Use: A powerful antibiotic often used for sinus infections and pneumonia.

Dosage: Often taken as a "Z-Pak" course over 3 to 5 days.

medicines.name: Ciprofloxacin 500mg
medicines.details:
Ciprofloxacin

Primary Use: Treats serious bacterial infections, particularly in the urinary tract.

⚠️ Warning: May cause tendon inflammation. Avoid excessive caffeine.

medicines.name: Metformin 500mg
medicines.details:
Metformin

Primary Use: First-line medication for the treatment of type 2 diabetes.

Instructions: Take with meals to reduce gastrointestinal side effects.

medicines.name: Insulin Injection
medicines.details:
Insulin Injection

Primary Use: Essential for Type 1 diabetics and some Type 2 diabetics to regulate blood sugar.

Storage: Must be kept refrigerated (not frozen).

⚠️ Warning: Monitor for hypoglycemia (low blood sugar).

medicines.name: Pantoprazole 40mg
medicines.details:
Pantoprazole

Primary Use: A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that decreases stomach acid production.

Instructions: Usually taken 30-60 minutes before breakfast.

medicines.name: Omeprazole 20mg
medicines.details:
Omeprazole

Primary Use: Treats heartburn, acid reflux, and gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

medicines.name: ORS Powder
medicines.details:
ORS (Oral Rehydration Salts)

Primary Use: Replaces lost fluids and electrolytes during diarrhea.

Instructions: Dissolve one sachet in the specified amount of clean water.

medicines.name: Salbutamol Inhaler
medicines.details:
Salbutamol Inhaler

Primary Use: A "reliever" inhaler for quick relief of asthma symptoms like wheezing.

Instructions: Use as needed for sudden breathlessness.

medicines.name: Atorvastatin 10mg
medicines.details:
Atorvastatin

Primary Use: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides in the blood.

Warning: Avoid large amounts of grapefruit juice while on this medication.

medicines.name: Iron Tablets
medicines.details:
Iron Supplement

Primary Use: Treats and prevents iron-deficiency anemia.

Instructions: Vitamin C helps absorption; avoid tea or coffee for 1 hour after taking.

medicines.name: Hydrocortisone Cream
medicines.details:
Hydrocortisone Cream

Primary Use: Relieves skin inflammation, itching, and rashes.

⚠️ Warning: Apply a thin layer; do not use on the face for more than a few days.

medicines.name: Melatonin 3mg
medicines.details:
Melatonin 3mg

Primary Use: Short-term treatment for jet lag and sleep cycle regulation.

Instructions: Take 30-60 minutes before your intended bedtime.
